data.name: index_stopmsg
data.value: Click this button to stop the Usermin server running on your system. Once stopped, no users will be able to login to it.

data.name: index_startmsg
data.value: Click this button to start the Usermin server on your system. Until it is started, users will not be able to login.

data.name: index_bootmsg
data.value: Change this option to control whether Usermin is started at boot time or not. If it is not currently started at boot and Yes is chosen, a new init script will be created.

data.name: index_install
data.value: Webmin can automatically download and install the latest version of Usermin for you. However, this should not be done if the program is already installed and is using a different configuration directory.

data.name: index_restartmsg
data.value: Click this button to re-start the Usermin server process. This may be necessary if you have recently upgraded Perl.

data.name: access_desc
data.value: O servidor Usermin pode ser configurado para negar ou permitir acesso somente alguns IP usando esse formulário. Hostnames (como foo.bar.com) e IP de redes (como 10.254.3.0 ou 10.254.1.0/255.255.255.128) podem também ser informados. Você deve limitar acessos ao seu servidor somente de endereços confiáveis, especialmente se estiver disponível na Internet. Caso contrario, qualquer um que adivinhar sua senha terá acesso completo ao seu sistema.

data.name: bind_desc2
data.value: Este formulário pode ser usado para mudar o número da porta que Usermin escuta, ou o coloca para escutar somente em um único endereço IP em seu sistema. Você pode também configurará-lo para aceitar conexões em várias portas, ou para escutar em diversos endereços IP. Nota - seu navegador pode alertá-lo para logar outra vez após ter mudado a porta ou o endereço de escuta.

data.name: bind_erestart
data.value: Um erro ocorreu ao inicializar o Usermin com as novas configurações de endereço e porta: $1

data.name: mods_desc1
data.value: Usermin modules can be added after installation by using the form to the right. Modules are typically distributed in <tt>.wbm</tt> files, each of which can contain one or more modules. Modules can also be installed from RPM files if supported by your operating system.

data.name: mods_desc2
data.value: If you wish to have more than one copy of the same module with different configurations, the form to the right allows you to clone any existing module. The clone will have a new name, a new module configuration and may be made available to different users.

data.name: mods_desc3
data.value: Existing modules can be deleted using the form below. Once a module has been deleted it must be reinstalled before you can use it again. A module cannot be deleted if other modules depend on it.

data.name: mods_desc4
data.value: Installed modules can be exported as a wbm.gz file using the form below. A module file can then be installed onto another system running Usermin.

data.name: os_desc3
data.value: This page displays the operating system detected by Usermin at install time, and the system that is currently detected. If they are different, you can choose to have Usermin's OS information updated, which may be necessary if you have recently upgraded.

data.name: os_desc2
data.value: You can also change the search path used by Usermin when running programs, and the shared library path passed to any programs.

data.name: os_iusermin
data.value: Internal OS code used by Usermin

data.name: os_update
data.value: Update Usermin to use detected OS

data.name: lang_intro
data.value: This page allows you to choose which language Usermin will use for displaying titles, prompts and messages

data.name: session_desc1
data.value: When enabled, password timeouts protect your Usermin server from brute-force password cracking attacks by adding a continuously expanding delay between each failed login attempt for the same user.

data.name: session_desc2
data.value: When session authentication is enabled, each logged in users' session will be tracked by Usermin, making it possible for idle users to be automatically logged out. Be aware that enabling or disabling session authentication may force all users to re-login.

data.name: session_realname
data.value: Show real hostname instead of name from URL?

data.name: session_authmode0
data.value: Use PAM for authentication, if available

data.name: session_authmode1
data.value: Authentication using password file $1 columns $2 and $3

data.name: session_eauthmode1
data.value: You must enter a password file if you have chosen that option

data.name: session_eauthmode2
data.value: You must enter an external authentication program if you have chosen that option

data.name: session_domain
data.value: Automatically try appending domain name to usernames?

data.name: session_strip
data.value: Automatically try stripping domain from usernames?

data.name: session_eusermap
data.value: Missing or non-existant username mapping file

data.name: session_blank
data.value: Prompt users with empty password to choose one at first login?

data.name: session_homedir
data.value: Create missing home directories after login?

data.name: session_ehomedir_perms
data.value: Missing or invalid octal home directory permissions

data.name: themes_desc
data.value: Themes control the appearance of the Usermin user interface, including icons, colours, backgrounds and possibly the layout of pages. The selection box below can be used to choose one of the themes installed on your system that will be the default for Usermin users.

data.name: themes_installdesc
data.value: Use the form below to install a new Usermin theme on your system. Themes are typically distributed in <tt>.wbt</tt> files, but can also be installed from RPM files if supported by your operating system.

data.name: themes_ebrowser
data.value: Your browser does not support file uploads

data.name: themes_einfo
data.value: Theme $1 is missing a theme.info file

data.name: themes_enone
data.value: File does not appear to contain any themes

data.name: themes_done
data.value: The following themes have been successfully installed on your system :

data.name: themes_ecomp
data.value: File is compressed, but the $1 command was not found on your system

data.name: themes_egzip
data.value: File is gzipped, but the $1 command was not found on your system

data.name: themes_ok
data.value: Theme changed successfully .. redirecting to the Webmin index page.

data.name: themes_delete
data.value: This form can be used to delete one of the themes installed on your system that is not currently in use.

data.name: themes_desc4
data.value: Installed themes can be exported as a wbt.gz file using the form below. A theme file can then be installed onto another system running Usermin.

data.name: configs_ecannot
data.value: Você não tem permissão para configurar esse módulo

data.name: configs_desc
data.value: Selecione da lista abaixo o modulo que você deseja configurar ..

data.name: configs_globaldesc
data.value: As configurações neste formulário aplicam-se a todos os usuários do módulo, e geralmente ajustam as opções relacionadas aos programas e arquivos que usam.

data.name: configs_userdesc
data.value: As configurações neste formulário definem os padrões para preferências editáveis por usuários para este módulo. A menos que você especifique, as mesmas podem ser alterados pelos usuários.

data.name: acl_desc
data.value: Use esta pagina para selecionar quais módulos instalados no Usermin estarão visíveis para os usuários.

data.name: ssl_desc1
data.value: The host on which Usermin is running appears to have the SSLeay Perl module installed. Using this, Usermin supports SSL encrypted communication between your browser and the server. If users are accessing your Usermin server over the Internet, then you should definitely consider using SSL to prevent an attacker capturing their passwords.

data.name: ssl_desc2
data.value: Warning - only turn on SSL support if you have a browser that supports SSL (such as Netscape or IE), and there is no firewall blocking https requests between your browser and the Usermin host.

data.name: ssl_newkey
data.value: This form can be used to create a new SSL key for your Usermin server.

data.name: ssl_hole
data.value: Because you are currently using the default Usermin SSL key that everyone has access to, you should generate a new key immediately. Otherwise your SSL connection is not secure!

data.name: newkey_ok
data.value: Successfully generated the following SSL key for Usermin.

data.name: stop_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to stop Usermin

data.name: start_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to start Usermin

data.name: users_desc
data.value: Usermin can be configured to limit which unix users and groups are allowed to login, using this form. To specify all primary members of a unix group, enter <tt>@groupname</tt> into the list.

data.name: users_desc2
data.value: To match a range of UIDs, enter <tt>start-end</tt>, <tt>start-</tt> or <tt>-end</tt> into the list.

data.name: users_egroup
data.value: '$1' is not a valid group name

data.name: users_shells
data.value: Negar usuários os quais o shell não estão no arquivo

data.name: defacl_desc
data.value: This page allows you to configure various access control option that apply to Usermin modules and users. These options are similar to those in the Global ACL for each user in the Webmin Users module.

data.name: defacl_header
data.value: Access control options for Usermin users

data.name: defacl_err
data.value: Failed to save access control options

data.name: install_ebrowser
data.value: Your browser does not support file uploads

data.name: install_einfo
data.value: Module $1 is missing a module.info file

data.name: install_enone
data.value: File does not appear to contain any modules

data.name: install_eos
data.value: Module $1 does not support this operating system ($2 $3)

data.name: install_eusermin
data.value: Module $1 is for Webmin, not Usermin

data.name: install_ever
data.value: Module $1 requires Usermin version $2 or above

data.name: install_desc
data.value: The following modules have been successfully installed and added to all users' access control list :

data.name: install_ecomp
data.value: File is compressed, but the $1 command was not found on your system

data.name: install_egzip
data.value: File is gzipped, but the $1 command was not found on your system

data.name: install_erpm
data.value: Not a Usermin module or theme RPM

data.name: install_eneither
data.value: RPM does not contain a usermin module or theme

data.name: delete_edep
data.value: Module $1 cannot be deleted, as the module $2 depends on it

data.name: delete_msg
data.value: The following modules have been successfully deleted from your Usermin installation :

data.name: delete_rusure
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the module(s) $2 ? $1 kB of files will be deleted forever.

data.name: delete_rusure2
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the theme $2 ? $1 kB of files will be deleted forever.

data.name: ui_desc
data.value: This form allows you to edit user interface options used by all Usermin modules.

data.name: ui_gotoone
data.value:
Go direct to module
if user only has one?

data.name: ui_gotomodule
data.value: After login, always go to module

data.name: ui_nohost
data.value: Show version, hostname and OS on main menu?

data.name: upgrade_delete
data.value: Delete old version's directory after upgrade?

data.name: upgrade_err2
data.value: Failed to upgrade from uploaded file

data.name: upgrade_ebrowser
data.value: Your browser does not support file uploads

data.name: upgrade_elatest
data.value: You are already running the latest version of Usermin

data.name: upgrade_erpm
data.value: Not a valid Usermin RPM file

data.name: upgrade_egunzip
data.value: Your system does not have the <tt>gunzip</tt> command

data.name: upgrade_etar
data.value: Not a valid Usermin tar file

data.name: upgrade_ewebmin
data.value: File is Webmin version $1, not a Usermin update.

data.name: upgrade_eupdates
data.value: Failed to download list of updates : $1

data.name: update_show
data.value: Only show which modules would be updated

data.name: update_missing
data.value: Install modules that are not currently installed

data.name: update_none
data.value: No Usermin updates for this version.

data.name: assignment_desc
data.value: Este formulário permite você configurar qual categoria cada módulo é exibido na página index do Usermin.

data.name: categories_desc
data.value: Este formulário permite que você renomear as categorias existentes do Usermin e críar novas para atribuir aos módulos. A parte superior da tabela é para mudar as descrições das categorias internas, enquanto que a parte inferior é para adicionar novas IDs de categorias e descrições.

data.name: categories_ecat
data.value: ID $1 de categoria já está em uso

data.name: update_mmissing
data.value: Module $1 is not installed on this system.

data.name: update_malready
data.value: Module $1 is already up to date.

data.name: update_mshow
data.value: Update needed for module $1 to version $2.

data.name: update_mos
data.value: Update to module $1 is not related to this OS.

data.name: update_ehour
data.value: Missing or invalid hour to update on

data.name: update_edays
data.value: Missing or invalid number of days

data.name: update_rv
data.value: Checking for updated Usermin modules from $1

data.name: update_eemail
data.value: You must enter an email address if only showing what would be updated.

data.name: update_version
data.value: A new release of Usermin (version $1) is now available for download. Future updates will be released only for the latest version.

data.name: restrict_add
data.value: Add a new user or group restriction

data.name: restrict_efile
data.value: Missing, non-existant or non-absolute users and groups file

data.name: bootup_ecannot
data.value: Você não tem permissão para configurar a inicialização

data.name: acl_stop
data.value: Pode parar e iniciar o Usermin?

data.name: acl_bootup
data.value: Pode configurar a inicilização em tempo de boot ?

data.name: acl_ecannot
data.value: Você não tem permissão para usar essa pagina

data.name: sessions_desc
data.value: Current Usermin session logins are listed below. To cancel an existing session and force the user to login again, click on its session ID.

data.name: sessions_none
data.value: No users are currently logged into Usermin.

data.name: referers_desc
data.value: This page allows you to configure Usermin's referrer checking support, which is used to prevent malicious links from other websites tricking your users' browsers into doing dangerous things with Usermin. However, if you have links to Usermin from your own websites that you don't want to be warned about you should add those sites to the list below.

data.name: anon_desc
data.value: Esta página permite você liberar acesso aos módulos e diretórios do Usermin selecionados sem a necessidade dos clientes conectarem. Para cada diretório de módulo que você colocar abaixo (como /commands ou /changepass) você precisa colocar também o nome do usuário Unix das quais as permissões serão usadas para acesso ao módulo.

data.name: anon_euser
data.value: Usuário Unix faltando ou inválido para o caminho URL '$1'

data.name: logout_desc
data.value: This page can be used to configure different inactivity logout times for different Usermin users. The timeout must be entered in minutes, and a timeout of zero means that sessions for matching users will never be automatically logged out.

data.name: logout_euser
data.value: Missing or invalid user in row $1

data.name: logout_egroup
data.value: Missing or invalid group in row $1

data.name: logout_efile
data.value: Missing or non-existant file in row $1

data.name: logout_etime
data.value: Missing or invalid timeout in row $1

data.name: logout_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to configure logout times

data.name: dav_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to configure the DAV server

data.name: dav_emodule
data.value: The Perl module $1 needed to enable DAV is not installed.

data.name: dav_desc
data.value: Usermin's DAV support allows clients that support the DAV protocol to connect to this Usermin server and read and write files. All file access with be done with the Unix privileges of the logged-in user, and will be restricted to the specified directory.

data.name: dav_err
data.value: Failed to save DAV server options

data.name: descs_info
data.value: This page allows you to specify alternate titles for Usermin modules, to override their standard descriptions.

data.name: blocked_none
data.value: Nenhum usuário ou host estão atualmente bloqueados pelo Usermin.

data.name: blocked_cleardesc
data.value: Clique neste botão para limpar todos os bloqueios atuais de usuário e host, reiniciando o processo do servidor Usermin.
